forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 34. Northwest wind around 10 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. Northwest wind 9 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph.

weather_report:
As dusk settles over Boston, the evening air is crisp and holds a promise of clarity. Tonight, the skies remain largely clear, unmarred by the fog that might have blurred the edges of the horizon. A gentle northwest breeze whispers through the neighborhoods, its playful gusts nudging the fallen leaves, reminding us of the season’s steadfast march towards winter. With temperatures dipping close to the mid-thirties, a light jacket or a cozy sweater will be your companion if you choose to stroll the quiet streets, perhaps pausing to admire the shimmering lights twinkling against the deepening night.

Looking ahead to tomorrow, Boston greets the day with radiant sun, a picturesque contrast to the chill of the previous night. As the sun rises, expect the temperatures to climb to the upper fifties before settling back into the low fifties as afternoon draws near. The northwest winds will continue to serve as a brisk reminder of autumn, so layering is advisable—think a comfortable tee beneath a warm cardigan. A walk along the Esplanade would be a lovely way to embrace the day’s mildness, with the golden light dancing on the water’s surface, inviting you to partake in the beauty of this fleeting season. Alternatively, a visit to a cozy café, where the aroma of fresh coffee mingles with the warmth of pastries, could provide the perfect refuge from the chill.
